trait.name: Spherical errors (nearsightedness and farsightedness)
trait.description: Spherical errors are refractive errors where the image is focused either in front or behind the retina, making the image blurry. Spherical errors include myopia (nearsightedness) and hyperopia (farsightedness).

trait.name: High-grade myopia
trait.description: High-grade myopia, or severe nearsightedness, is defined as having myopia measuring at -6 diopters or worse.

cite.author: Li Z, Qu J, Xu X, Zhou X, Zou H, Wang N, Li T, Hu X, Zhao Q, Chen P, Li W, Huang K, Yang J, He Z, Ji J, Wang T, Li J, Li Y, Liu J, Zeng Z, Feng G, He L, Shi Y
cite.title: A genome-wide association study reveals association between common variants in an intergenic region of 4q25 and high-grade myopia in the Chinese Han population.

genotype.longmeaning: Slightly higher odds of developing high-grade myopia.
Typical odds of devloping high-grade myopia.
Slightly lower odds of developing high-grade myopia
